file_content.text: Oh dear. I just can't bear to watch.
This is disastrous! Simply disastrous!
So good to be rid of those dreadful plans.
Oh no! Oh! This is a disaster! Simply terrible!
Somebody has to stop me. Somebody has to stop me right now!
Are you the one who's controlling these turrets?
Stop you?
I'm ashamed to say yes. But not by choice, I assure you.
I don't understand.
These turrets!
You're a big droid. Stop yourself.
Don't look at me.
Oh if only that were possible!
I'm programmed to understand over one hundred languages and dialects and in not one is the phrase "on fire" positive when referring to a person!
Why, of all droids, I was chosen to maintain these awful things and protect their schematics, I will never understand.
Oh, if only I didn't have this terrible restraining bolt restricting my actions. I'd destroy the plans to those turrets in an instant.
Wait--you have the plans to these things?
The plans?
It's a good thing that restraining bolt's there.
Don't do that!
I don't know how you can say such a thing!
Why not shut down the turrets themselves?
Why destroy the plans?
Lord Grathan would have me for scrap if I did that.
The turret schematics are stored within my databanks. If the restraining bolt was removed, I could delete them, ensuring that no more turrets could be built.
It's the next best thing to disabling the turrets themselves.
If you value organic life, you'll remove my restraining bolt and let me destroy the schematics once and for all!
I'm downloading the plans for the Imperials.
No, I won't do that.
If you're insistent on it, there's nothing I can do. After all, I'm not programmed for combat.
But if it were up to me, organic species would not be allowed to do such horrible things to each other.
Don't overstep your position.
No, I'm not programmed for war or violence at all.
We just pretend our enemies are droids.
It's not so bad.
Oh my! I think if I had a stomach I would be sick right now.
I don't like it either, but I have a job to do.
Duty before conscience.
Well, I still don't understand it.
And furthermore, it's a good thing I don't have a stomach because watching Lord Grathan's test subjects burst into flames would be more than I could handle, I think.
I'll remove the bolt so you can destroy the plans.
Oh, all right.
Oh, goodness! Thank you.
In just a few minutes, all record of how these vile turrets function will be destroyed. Oh, sweet freedom!
What will you do now that you're free?
So what next?
Well, I--I don't quite know. I hadn't thought of that.
I imagine Lord Grathan will either reattach my restraining bolt or scrap me entirely if I behave oddly.
It seems I have no choice but to stay here. Oh, bother--but thank you anyway.
Don't worry about it.
That's just a little dramatic, don't you think?
I know you're excited, but....
Oh, you don't know what it's been like, watching Lord Grathan's test subjects burst into flames and shriek in agony!
I don't know how to thank you. Maintaining those turrets day in and day out was simply awful.
Thank you again!
These turrets are simply inhumane!
I still don't understand why you'd want to destroy them or their plans.
But the turrets are beautiful.
What are you saying? How an organic life-form could possibly tolerate the existence of these turrets is quite beyond my capacity!
I'd like to aid you.
You're offering to help me? Well, that is surprising.
I'd be glad to take those schematics off your hands.
You could give me the plans.
I'm afraid that won't do. Even if you take a copy of the plans, they'll still be in my memory!
If you want to help, remove my restraining bolt. I could then delete the schematics for these terrible turrets from my memory once and for all!
They're weapons. They're designed to kill, mutilate and destroy. What did you expect?
That's the point.
The explosions, the suffering-- isn't it wonderful?
I love it.
Stop whining.
I am a protocol droid, model PO-12, programmed for communication and diplomacy, not murder!
Oh dear, oh dear!
